alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 12 at 5:37PM MST until January 12 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... East central Carbon County in south central Wyoming... Central Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 536 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Bosler to near Hanna, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow across the Interstate 80 corridor from Elk Mountain to just north of Laramie. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph expected. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and likely dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 242 and 296. Locations impacted include... Hanna, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Bosler, and Arlington. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
